document.discussion_title: Racist chants towards Inaki Williams ends match
document.topic_text: Print This Inaki Williams Athletic Club’s trip to Sporting Gijon was marred by racist chanting aimed at Ghana target Inaki Williams. The Bilbao hitman who is eligible to play for Ghana suffered abuse from a section of fans, with referee Clos Gomez pausing the game midway through the first half, with players from Sporting asking their fans to stop the abuse at El Molinon. Inaki Williams, 22, became the first black player to score for Bilbao in 2014. The Basque side tweeted about the incident, writing: “The referee has stopped the play for a few moments because of racist shouts from the stand at Inaki Williams.” Courtesy of GHANAsoccernet.com - Ghana's leading football news website. Click for more news.
